triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: HELM evaluates language models like GPT-3, PaLM, and ChatGPT to understand their capabilities and limitations.

triples.name: GPT-3
triples.relevance: GPT-3 is one of the major language models evaluated as part of the HELM benchmark.

triples.name: PaLM
triples.relevance: PaLM is a large language model developed by Google AI that is benchmarked in HELM.

triples.name: ChatGPT
triples.relevance: ChatGPT is an OpenAI-developed language model included in the HELM evaluation.

triples.name: Generative pre-trained transformer
triples.relevance: GPT models are based on the generative pre-trained transformer architecture that underlies modern language models.

triples.name: Transformer (deep learning)
triples.relevance: The transformer architecture is the foundational neural network design underlying all evaluated language models.

triples.name: Language model benchmark
triples.relevance: HELM proposes a comprehensive benchmark for holistically evaluating language models across multiple scenarios and metrics.

triples.name: Knowledge representation and reasoning
triples.relevance: HELM includes targeted evaluation of reasoning and world knowledge capabilities in language models.

triples.name: Disinformation
triples.relevance: HELM evaluates risks of disinformation generation by language models as part of its targeted evaluations.

triples.name: Generative artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Language models are central to generative AI, and HELM evaluates their capabilities and risks.
